rules: object.
args: object.
scope: object.
method: object.
callback: object.

beforeArgs: object.
Returns the arguments being passed to the method.
On after methods and after phase of around methods, returns the args passed to the before chain of the aspect.
Returns a method that must be invoked with a return status when returning {@link AspectAttribute.ASYNC}.
Returns: Function
When accessible, returns the object that made the call to the method.
Returns the definition of the wraped method, accessible for reflection purposes.
Returns the rule parameters defined when the attribute was applied.
Returns the scope of the method.

Class Event
{String}Base Event object in A5.
Creates a new Event instance.
type: String. The type identifier for the event.
bubbles=false: Boolean, Optional. Whether or not the event should use the bubbling phase.
data: Object, Optional. an optional data object to pass along with the event to registered listeners.
bubbles: object.
Static Properties
Event.DESTROYED
Whether this event should use the bubbling phase. All events use capture and target phases.
Cancels the propagation of the event. Once this method is called, any event listeners that have not yet processed this event instance will be ignored.
finishCurrentPhase: Boolean. If true, the event is allowed to finish dispatching in the current phase, but will be cancelled before the next phase begins.
The object that is currently processing this event.
Returns: a5.Object
The object that is currently processing this event.
The data object passed along with the event dispatch, if present.
Returns: Object
The phase this event is currently in. (a5.Event.CAPTURING, a5.Event.AT_TARGET, or a5.Event.BUBBLING)
Returns: Number
The phase this event is currently in.

When shouldRetain is set to true, the event instance will not be destroyed after it has finished being dispatched. This defaults to false, and it is recommended that you do NOT set this to true unless the same event is being dispatched on a timer, and the instance can be reused.
value: Boolean, Optional. If set to true, the event instance will not be destroyed after it has finished being dispatched.
The object that dispatched this event.
Returns: a5.Object
The object that dispatched this event.
The event type.
Returns: String
The event type.
Abstract Class EventDispatcher
{String}Handles event listeners and dispatches events.
Creates a new EventDispatcher instance.
Static Properties
EventDispatcher.ADD
EventDispatcher.REMOVE
Adds an event listener to the object.
type: String. The event type to be added.
method: Function. The associated listener method to be added.
useCapture=false: Boolean, Optional. If set to true, the listener will process the event in the capture phase. Otherwise, it will process the event bubbling or target phase.
scope=null: a5.Object, Optional. Applies a scope value for the listener method. This is important when listening from a prototype.
useCapture: object.
scope: object.
Adds an event listener to the object that fires only once, then is removed.
type: String. The event type to be added.
method: Function. The associated listener method to be added.
useCapture=false: Boolean, Optional. If set to true, the listener will process the event in the capture phase. Otherwise, it will process the event bubbling or target phase.
scope=null: a5.Object, Optional. Applies a scope value for the listener method. This is important when listening from a prototype.
useCapture: object.
scope: object.
Returns whether autoPurge is enabled for the dispatcher. If enabled, event listeners will be removed automatically after a valid event is dispatched.
value: Boolean, Optional. If passed, sets the value for autoPurge.

Sends an event object to listeners previously added to the event chain. By default an event object with a target property is sent pointing to the sender. If a custom object is sent with a target property, this property will not be overridden.
event: String|a5.Event. The event object to dispatch. Or, if a string is passed, the 'type' parameter of the event to dispatch.
data: object.
bubbles: object.
Override this method to be notified of listener addition or removal.
e: Object. The event object
e.type: String. - The event type associated with the change.
e.method: Object. - The listener method associated with the change.
e.changeType: String. - Specifies what the type the change was, either EventDispatcher.ADD or EventDispatcher.REMOVE.
Returns the total number of listeners attached to the parent object.
type: object.
Returns whether the object has a valid listener for the associated type, and optionaly a specified listener method.
type: String. The event type to check.
method: Function, Optional. A listener method reference.
Returns: Boolean
Removes all existing listeners.
Remove a listener from the parent object.
type: String. The event type to be removed.
method: Function. The associated listener method to be removed.
useCapture=false: Boolean, Optional. Whether the listener to remove is bound to the capture phase or the bubbling phase.
scope: a5.Object, Optional.
isOneTime=false: Boolean, Optional.
useCapture: object.
isOneTime: object.
Class EventPhase
{String}Defines event phases for an {@link a5.Event}.
AT_TARGET
BUBBLING
CAPTURING

Final Class AjaxCallAttribute
{String}Adds ajax call wrapping logic to a method. Calls to methods with this attribute are assumed to execute a call to a method on the endpoint of the same name.

Final Class CL
{String}The instance of an A5 CL application, acting as both a reference instance for core components via its methods and as a global binder object.
Creates a new CL instance.
params: Object.
Returns a reference to the application package.
returnString=false: Boolean, Optional. If true is passed, returns the string value of the namespace of the application package.
root: Boolean, Optional.
Defines A5 CL client environment types. One of 'DESKTOP', 'MOBILE', or 'TABLET'.

Defines A5 CL client platform types.
Values:
'BB6' - BlackBerry OS 6
'BB' - BlackBerry OS 5 and under
'IOS' - Apple iOS
'ANDROID' - Google Android
'IE' - Internet Explorer
'UNKNOWN' - Unknown platform.
Defines AirFrame CL development environment types. One of 'DEVELOPMENT', 'TEST', or 'PRODUCTION'.
Includes external content into the application.
value: String.
callback: function.
itemCallback: function, Optional.
allowReplacements=true: Boolean, Optional.
onError: function, Optional.
Returns whether the application is running on http:// or file://
Returns whether the client environment supports manifest caching.
Returns the current online state of the client browser, where supported.
Returns the current launch state of the application, a value from TODO
restartOnComplete: Boolean, Optional. Restarts the application after purging the cache.
Purges the manifest cache data in applicationStorage, if applicable.
restartOnComplete: Boolean, Optional. Restarts the application after purging the cache.
Restarts the application.

Abstract Class CLAddon

{String}CLAddons are top level member plugins for A5 CL. CLAddons augment the plugin model by allowing for custom configuration rules, the ability to define custom registrable processes for other plugins, and the ability register custom class types for auto instantiation.
Creates a new CLAddon instance.

Defines a new config method for CLMain. This method should be called in the constructor of the addon. Values added dynamically create a method with a 'set' prefix, much like the existing setConfig method. For example, a value of 'foo' would create a method named setFoo() in CLMain.
type: String.
process: object.
Returns a direct reference to parameters passed to the a5.cl.CreateApplication call.
Gets the values set via CLMain for a type defined in createMainConfigMethod.
type: Object.

Must be override as a starting point for the addon. This method is called after all addons have been loaded, but prior to plugins loading. It is not necessary to call super on this method when overriding.

Abstract Class CLAjax
{String}Base class for Ajax endpoint consumers.
Creates a new CLAjax instance.
Aborts all calls associated with the service.
id: Number, Optional. A specific request ID to abort instead of aborting all pending requests.
Performs a call on the service. initialize must be called first.
method: String. The method to call on the endpoint. An empty string or null may be passed to call services that do not define methods.
data: Object, Optional. A data object to pass as JSON.
callback: Function, Optional. A function to pass returned results to.
props: Object, Optional. Call props object.
m: object.
Gets or sets the silent property. When set to true, requests will not trigger ASYNC_START and ASYNC_COMPLETE events.
value: Boolean.

Abstract Class CLMain
Creates a new CLMain instance.
params=null: Object, Optional. An optional object of parameters to pass into the application instance. Must be passed as a parameter to a5.cl.CreateApplication.

Abstract Class CLPlugin
{String}Defines a plugin for an A5 CL application.
Creates a new CLPlugin instance.
Sets the default config params and their values for the plugin.
value: Object.
Initialization method for the plugin, called when all plugins have been loaded. Override does not require super call.

Specifies a maximum version of A5 CL that the plugin has been validated for. Setting allowUntestedPlugins to true on A5 CL config will allow a plugin to run in CL with a version number higher than this specified value.
value: String.
Returns the plugin configuration object, merging default values with overrides from the application CLMain instance.
Returns: Object
Associates the plugin with the specified registerable plugin process, either of the A5 CL framework directly or of an addon that specifies its own registrable processes.
type: String.
Specifies a required minimum version of A5 CL for the plugin.
value: String.
Specifies a require class or package for the plugin.
val: String.

Class Binder
{String}Adds capabilities to a class to manage bindings.

Creates a bind between a data source and a receiver.
source: a5.cl.mixins.BindableSource.

params: Object. Parameters for the binding source, as specified by the receiver.
mapping: Object, Optional. If specified, remaps properties by name to new values.

persist=false: Object, Optional. If set to true, the binding will remain active if bindings are set to disabled.
persist: object.
Returns whether bindings are active.
Returns: Boolean
Sets whether bindings are currently enabled. If set to false, all bindings are suspended, unless a binding has its persist value set to true.
value: Boolean.
Removes a given binding, if it exists.

Class DataStore

{String}Mixin class for providing data storage hooks. DataStore applies a uniqe ID prefix on key values, removing the need to assure uniqueness of keys in your application. Key prefixes are unique to the class in which they are referenced.
Creates a new DataStore instance.
Returns whether caching has previously been set by the application on the client and values are available for retrieval.
Clears all key/value pairs associated with the class in which the method is called.
exceptions: Array, Optional. An array of keys to leave untouched when clearing.
Removes the value for the specified key from the client data store.
key: object.
Retrieves a value for the specified key from the client data store.
key: object.
Specifies a predefined prefix name for values when stored in localStorage.
value: Object.
Stores a value uniquely keyed in the localStorage cache.
key: String.
value: String.
